org.spongepowered.api.util.gen

Interface BiomeBuffer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ImmutableBiomeArea, MutableBiomeArea

    public interface BiomeBuffer
    An buffer for BiomeType data. This buffer has no direct relation to the world and changes to it are not synchronized to the world.

    Unlike BiomeArea, buffers are guaranteed to be loaded in memory as a whole. Calling methods like getBiome(Vector2i) will never result in new terrain being generated. As a result of this, biome buffers are much more restricted in size than a BiomeArea.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BiomeType getBiome(int x, int z)
      Gets the BiomeType at the given location.
      BiomeType getBiome(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector2i position)
      Get an object representing the biome at the given position.
      com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector2i getBiomeMax()
      Gets the biome location with the highest x and y that is still a valid position for getBiome(Vector2i).
      com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector2i getBiomeMin()
      Gets the biome location with the lowest x and y that is still a valid position for getBiome(Vector2i).
      com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector2i getBiomeSize()
      Gets the size of the area.

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector2i getBiomeMin()
        Gets the biome location with the lowest x and y that is still a valid position for getBiome(Vector2i).
        Returns:

      • getBiomeMax

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector2i getBiomeMax()
        Gets the biome location with the highest x and y that is still a valid position for getBiome(Vector2i).
        Returns:
        The highest biome location.

      • getBiomeSize

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector2i getBiomeSize()
        Gets the size of the area. Defined as getBiomeMax() - getBiomeMin() + (1, 1).
        Returns:
        The size
